title: Loading AGnews dataset after fresh install fails with ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'aiohttp'
body:
I've installed Ludwig latest in a new environment:
```
python -m pip install git+https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig.git 
```

Then I run:

```python
from ludwig.datasets import agnews

# Loads the dataset as a pandas.DataFrame
ag_news_df = agnews.load()

# Prints a preview of the first five rows.
ag_news_df.head(5)
```

(Running the CLI version also gives the same error)
```
ludwig datasets download agnews
```

I get this error:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ModuleNotFoundError                       Traceback (most recent call last)
[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/fsspec/registry.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in get_filesystem_class(protocol)
    218         try:
--> 219             register_implementation(protocol, _import_class(bit["class"]))
    220         except ImportError as e:

17 frames
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'aiohttp'

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/fsspec/registry.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in get_filesystem_class(protocol)
    219             register_implementation(protocol, _import_class(bit["class"]))
    220         except ImportError as e:
--> 221             raise ImportError(bit["err"]) from e
    222     cls = registry[protocol]
    223     if getattr(cls, "protocol", None) in ("abstract", None):

ImportError: HTTPFileSystem requires "requests" and "aiohttp" to be installed
```

After installing `aiohttp` with pip install this works with no error.
```
pip install aiohttp
```
